conclusion: Analyze the circuit to determine equivalent resistance and capacitance, then calculate charge passing through R1 after switch is opened.
Depicts series-parallel circuit with resistors R1, R2, capacitors C1, C2, electromotive force E, and switch S.
Switch is initially closed, then opened; image shows equivalent circuit and charge passing through R1.
Switch S is closed, connecting two paths in series.
Equivalent resistance Req of resistors in series is 10.0 Ω.
Equivalent capacitance Ceq of capacitors in parallel is 60 μF.
Entire electromotive force E is across Ceq when switch is closed.
Charge Q stored in equivalent capacitor is 600 μC.
When switch is opened, Ceq is in series with Req.
Time constant τ of the circuit is 600 μs.
Charge Q passing through R1 calculated using formula with time constant τ.
Charge passing through R1 is 600 μC.
